intro: Dicoma incana, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fuzzy, silver-gray leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Dicoma incana typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other regions for horticultural purposes.
